cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 430 miles southwest of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northeastward across the Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Panhandle, then forecast to sweep quickly across Georgia and the Carolinas and move offshore of the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Florida Panhandle coast between Panama City and Apalachicola

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mississippi/Alabama border to Yankeetown FL, and Grand Isle LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River (storm-surge warning Indian Pass FL to Clearwater Beach FL)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle eastward across Georgia and the Carolinas to the southeastern Virginia coast
weather_observation.wind: Low to moderate chance (≤11%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gale-force gusts possible Sunday night into early Monday as the center passes offshore
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft possible around times of high tide; no significant surge expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible Sunday into Monday which could produce localized street and low-lying area flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and rip currents along Virginia beaches late Sunday and Monday
